SEARCH
Package executor.service.service.scenario

Class ScenarioHttpService

java.lang.Object
executor.service.service.scenario.ScenarioHttpService
All Implemented Interfaces:
ScenarioService
@Service public class ScenarioHttpService extends Object implements ScenarioService
Service class for managing scenarios through HTTP communication.

The ScenarioHttpService class implements the ScenarioService interface and is designed to manage scenarios through HTTP communication. It utilizes a Queue to handle the scenarios in a first-in, first-out (FIFO) manner. This class acts as a bridge between the application's scenario management and an external system that communicates scenarios via HTTP.

The class declares the following attributes:

  • scenarioQueue: A Queue used to store and manage scenarios in a FIFO manner.

Implementations of this class should provide methods for adding scenarios to the queue, processing scenarios, and possibly communicating with an external system to exchange scenarios over HTTP.

It is recommended for scenarios using HTTP communication to manage and process scenarios to utilize this class as a central point for handling the scenario queue and related HTTP operations.

  • Constructor Details

    • ScenarioHttpService

      public ScenarioHttpService(ScenarioQueueHolder scenarioQueueHolder)
      Constructs a ScenarioHttpService with the specified scenario queue.

      The constructor initializes a new instance of the ScenarioHttpService class with the provided scenario queue. The scenario queue is obtained from the provided ScenarioQueueHolder instance, allowing the service to work with a pre-configured queue for managing scenarios.

      The constructor takes a single parameter:

      • scenarioQueueHolder: An instance of ScenarioQueueHolder providing access to the scenario queue.

      The class is designed for managing scenarios through HTTP and utilizes an internal scenario queue for queuing scenarios awaiting execution.

      It is recommended to use this constructor when creating a ScenarioHttpService instance and providing a pre-configured scenario queue through a ScenarioQueueHolder.

      Parameters:
      scenarioQueueHolder - An instance of ScenarioQueueHolder providing access to the scenario queue.
      See Also:
      • ScenarioQueueHolder
      • ScenarioHttpService

  • Method Details

    • saveScenario

      public void saveScenario(Scenario scenario)
      Saves a scenario for execution.

      The saveScenario method is responsible for adding a scenario to the internal scenario queue for subsequent execution. The provided Scenario instance represents the scenario to be saved for execution.

      The method takes a single parameter:

      • scenario: The Scenario instance representing the scenario to be saved for execution.

      It is recommended to use this method when scenarios need to be queued for execution through HTTP. The scenario will be added to the internal queue, allowing for orderly processing of scenarios awaiting execution.

      Specified by:
      saveScenario in interface ScenarioService
      Parameters:
      scenario - The Scenario instance representing the scenario to be saved for execution.
      See Also:
      • Scenario
      • ScenarioHttpService

    • saveScenarios

      public void saveScenarios(List<Scenario> scenarios)
      Saves a list of scenarios for execution.

      The saveScenarios method is responsible for adding a list of scenarios to the internal scenario queue for subsequent execution. The provided List<Scenario> represents the scenarios to be saved for execution.

      The method takes a single parameter:

      • scenarios: A List<Scenario> representing the scenarios to be saved for execution.

      It is recommended to use this method when multiple scenarios need to be queued for execution through HTTP. The scenarios will be added to the internal queue, allowing for orderly processing of scenarios awaiting execution.

      Specified by:
      saveScenarios in interface ScenarioService
      Parameters:
      scenarios - A List<Scenario> representing the scenarios to be saved for execution.
      See Also:
      • Scenario
      • ScenarioHttpService

    • getScenariosByUsernameAndScenarioName

      public List<Scenario> getScenariosByUsernameAndScenarioName(String username, String scenarioName)
      Retrieves scenarios by username and scenario name.

      The getScenariosByUsernameAndScenarioName method is responsible for retrieving scenarios based on the provided username and scenario name. It filters the scenarios by matching the specified scenario name and username.

      The method takes two parameters:

      • username: A String representing the username for which scenarios are to be retrieved.
      • scenarioName: A String representing the scenario name to match against.

      It is recommended to use this method when specific scenarios need to be retrieved based on the username and scenario name. The method filters the scenarios and returns a list of matching scenarios for further processing.

      Specified by:
      getScenariosByUsernameAndScenarioName in interface ScenarioService
      Parameters:
      username - A String representing the username for which scenarios are to be retrieved.
      scenarioName - A String representing the scenario name to match against.
      Returns:
      A List<Scenario> containing scenarios matching the specified username and scenario name.
      See Also:
      • Scenario
      • ScenarioHttpService

    • getScenarioByName

      public Scenario getScenarioByName(String scenarioName)
      Retrieves a scenario by scenario name.

      The getScenarioByName method is responsible for retrieving a scenario based on the provided scenario name. It filters the scenarios by matching the specified scenario name and returns the first matching scenario, or null if no match is found.

      The method takes a single parameter:

      • scenarioName: A String representing the scenario name to match against.

      It is recommended to use this method when a specific scenario needs to be retrieved based on its name. The method filters the scenarios and returns the first scenario with the matching name for further processing.

      Specified by:
      getScenarioByName in interface ScenarioService
      Parameters:
      scenarioName - A String representing the scenario name to match against.
      Returns:
      The Scenario instance with the specified name, or null if no match is found.
      See Also:
      • Scenario
